intro: Mitrasacme polymorpha var. canescens, commonly known as the silverleaf mitrasacme, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which results from dense pubescence covering the leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, adding ornamental value to its appearance. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
